title: Sweet Little Piggy Flowers
medium: gouache, oil, and enamel on paper
provenance_text:
Alan Davie [1920-2014]; Gimpel Fils, Ltd, London, England, until October 1963; Herbert Seigle [1923-2013], McKeesport PA, October 1963; Mr. and Mrs. Edward Haskell [1920-1988], Pittsburgh, PA, by April 14,1967 until June 23, 1988 [1]; Jane (Mrs. Edward) Haskell [1923-2013], June 23, 1988 until May 28, 2013; partial gift to Carnegie Museum of Art, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1993, December 2005, and remainder bequest in September 2013. 

Notes:
[1]. The architect of the Haskell residence, Herb Seigle, received this painting from Gimpel Fils, Ltd, London in October 1963 at a price of $450.  The Haskells had bought a different work by the artist ("Miracle of the Burning Tree", 1961) from the same London firm shortly before that. By April 1967, the two owners swapped the two paintings. See correspondence from Ed Haskell in curatorial file.
